turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hi, good morning!

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hello there!

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hi there, this is uh this is Doctor Dean <UNIN/> from <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> .

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hello there? Um, I'm wondering if you can help me today.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, <UNIN/> sure, <UNIN/> I'll try. Before we start, could I please confirm your full name and date of birth?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, it's Sarah Smith, and it's the second of November, um, nineteen ninety two.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's great! Thank you, sir. So are you in a private place where you are OK to speak at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I am indeed, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, so tell me what's been going on.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK. I, I've really not been feeling so well at all recently. I, I've been struggling with fever for the past week. Yeah, I would say it's <UNIN/> about seven days ago. I'm just, I'm really hot and sweaty all the time, and just generally not feeling good.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright, sorry to hear that. Now, um, uh, along with this fever and this <UNIN/> any other symptoms at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I'd say that I'm aching all over really, my muscles are really aching. I'm feeling quite nauseous, uh, so I've not been able to eat very much, and I have been drinking but it's been quite a small amount.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, and, yeah, just generally quite tired and unwell. I'm sweating during the the the night, I'm quite cold.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. Um, and um, so <UNIN/> you're having periods of when you're feeling hot, and also periods when you're feeling cold as well.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, yes, quite interchangeable, not really a pattern to it.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, uh, and have you been taking your medication?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I've been trying to, like, take ibuprofen and paracetamol just to from over the counter, but it's not really helping, just been taking the recommended dose every day of those.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Sure</UNSURE>, and when you say it's not helping, is it bringing the temperature down at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Perhaps slightly, yes, but I'm still experiencing these symptoms, so, it does take the edge off a bit.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright. And can I just double check have you gotten any cough or cold or sore throat or <UNIN/> anything like that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mmm, not those sort of symptoms, really. Um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But which <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> are you getting, other than the ones you've already mentioned to me?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so, I have a habit

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: that it's mainly just the sweating, really, and the and the nausea, uh, that's overtaking all all day and, uh, the aching muscles all over.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure. Have you have you had any ear pain <UNIN/>?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mmm, no, my ears are fine, actually. I haven't had any problems with my ears.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, um, just, I just need to check for any other causes of infection in the body. So I'm gonna go through some, um, kind of systemic questions. Have you had any diarrhoea?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And <UNIN/> not, not really no, not that I can find.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Have you got any neck stiffness at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no. My neck's, my neck's been fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Alright. Um, do you have any headache?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Not more than usual, no. Just like the, general headaches but not, just from staring at the screen. <UNIN/> No migraines, or anything.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, so, you know your normal headache, where is that, in the back of your head or the front of the head?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uum, it's quite centralized over, over the head.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. <UNIN/> and how long have you been having that for?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: It's something that I've struggled with through, years really, just related to a screen use, or, uum, like changes in weather patterns. Yeah, high pressure days, sometimes I struggle with migraines, and headaches.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, have you got any rash on your body anywhere at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I haven't noticed any rashes, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, any joints swollen or tender or sore?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mmm, not really. I mean, I, I often have problems with back pain but <UNIN/> not really any other joints.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Any</UNSURE> problems?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Alright, <UNIN/> and, um, have you got any kind of symptoms down below when you're passing urine?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no,  there's been no problems there.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Any painful urination at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, not at all, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Are you passing urine more often than normal?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, <UNIN/> I  don't think so, no it's been fairly regular.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Have you been abroad anywhere recently?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, I have actually.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Where have you been?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I went to Vietnam. Uh, I came back four weeks ago now.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, and, um, uh, did you take malaria preventative medication when you went out there?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I did, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Which one did you take?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ooo, I can't remember now, off the top of my head.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Was it a weekly tablet or a daily tablet?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I think it was daily.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, um, and was it one tablet or was it another one that you would take on top of the first one?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I think it was, uh another one that I took on top of the first one.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, and what were you doing out in Vietnam? Was it just seeing the cities or going through villages or hiking? What what kind of activities were you doing?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: It was quite <UNIN/> really,  'cause we were there for a few weeks, and we toured to, uh, several different parts of the country, and uh, the countryside and some cities as well.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Uh, and um, did you do any kind of, were you in rivers or things like that? Were you, you know, <UNIN/> how adventurous were you?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm sorry, could you repeat that? I missed that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Where you going out into the rivers? Were you going on beaches? I mean how adventurous was your trip?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, it was quite adventurous. We were sort of trekking and, um, cycling, uh, through the farmland and, um, seeing how people lived in a day-to-day life in, in, in farmland.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Um, thank you for sharing that with me. Now, do you have, um, any other illnesses at all, in the past?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mmm, as I said I've, I've been struggling with back pain <UNSURE>for quite a while</UNSURE>,  but I haven't really had any, uh, major illnesses in the past, <UNSURE>I can think of</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And that back pain have you, um, have you seen anyone about that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, yeah, I'm under a physiotherapist at the moment for that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Have they, have they give you any kind of diagnosis at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, they've said that it's, <UNIN/> u,h related to long periods of time sitting at a desk, and just, uh, bad posture. So mainly the  exercises are focused on improving posture and, and to strengthen the muscles in the back.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Alright um, are there any illnesses in your family at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hmm, the main one would be, um, heart attack. My, my father passed away of that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>I'm sorry to hear that</UNSURE>. Um, how old was he when that happened?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: in his <UNSURE>sixties</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, sixty eight, I think. Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, are you on any medication at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, just <UNSURE>Seroxat</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Uh, <UNIN/> do you have any allergies <UNSURE>at all</UNSURE>? <UNIN/> medication?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I've just really pollen allergy. That's all I have.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, so hay fever.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, yeah, just hay fever.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Alright. Um, are you, um, you're working at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I am, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What do you work at?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I work as a nurse.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. Um, and, um, you're up to date with all the vaccinations, Hepatitis B, and that kind of thing?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, indeed. Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: But I'm, I'm really struggling quite a lot at work at the moment. It's been quite difficult, feeling so, uh, tired all the time.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>So, I can</UNSURE> <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure, OK. Um, and, are you a, uh, are you a smoker at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I'm not.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and ohh do you drink much alcohol?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mmm, moderate alcohol intake. Yeah, I don't drink too much.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and how much kind of physical exercise do you do normally?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I try and do, uh, some moderate physical exercise a few times a week.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, that's good, alright, um, so, um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What, uh, I think we're gonna need to do is we're gonna need to bring you into one of our clinics. <UNSURE>Examine</UNSURE> <UNIN/>, and we're gonna need to arrange some blood tests as well.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, um, so, what what I want to do is, the first question I have in my mind is that we need to find a reason for why you've got this <UNIN/> fever and these symptoms, because there's no apparent reason from what you've told me.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: There's no, uh, when someone has got fever and sweats, we want to find out have they got chest infection, have they got a throat infection?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and if we can't find a focus of infection, then that's something, that, that's an outstanding question that needs to be answered, OK?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, the second thing, second factor, is that you've recently come from, uh, Vietnam.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And you've had exposure to rural areas. And we need to think about things like malaria or other exotic infections as well. So, um, you're probably gonna need some blood tests.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: After you've been seen by somebody.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, now, the urgency of those blood tests depends partly on what we find when we examine you, which is why we're going to go, go for the examination first.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You <UNIN/> come into one of our clinics in central London, that's one option, and then the the GP there who examines you can then decide on how urgent the blood tests and things are going to be.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Or, if it's inconvenient for you to come into central London because you <UNIN/> you're living further out, you could actually just attend a local A and E.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I'm going to type up what my thought process is and what kind of test I think you need in the notes for this appointment, so you could show that to them at reception.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, I'll be asking for something called thick and thin blood films, to check for malaria.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And inflammatory markers and things like those, <UNIN/> technical terms, but they'll understand what that, what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But, um, I, I don't think you can go into work, uh, until we've sorted this out. And we, we, we need to sort this out sooner rather than later.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK. <UNIN/> That sounds great. Thank you so much for your help. I, I think, yeah, I can come straight into central London today to get that sorted.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, fine, so what I'm going to do is I will send a message to one of our admin team members asking them to book you in.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And if you can ring the number that I leave in your consultation notes, after a few minutes, and then they'll slot you in, and then we can sort things out from there. OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: That's brilliant. Thank you very much.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Alright then, OK. Take care then. All the best.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Bye.
